results.title: The Smile and the interweave: Madonna, child and Saint Anne (circa 1500-1515) Leonardo da Vinci, Vinci 1452-Amboise 1519
results.creator_credit: Alain Jaubert, Delta Image, La Sept, FR3 and Musée du Louvre
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Palettes”.
In the center Saint Anne: she wears her hair braided, her eyes are lowered and she is smiling. Seated on her knees, the Virgin Mary, wearing a low-necked dress, is leaning toward the infant Jesus. This mysterious painting is a fine example of all the qualities, which make Leonardo da Vinci’s work unique and recognisable. The video explores Leonardo’s techniques, the chromatic range he used, the composition and symbolism of the picture as well as its history and the life of its creator, whose “hand could not match his intellect”, resulting in very few completed works.
results.title_for_label: The Smile and the interweave: Madonna, child and Saint Anne (circa 1500-1515) Leonardo da Vinci, Vinci 1452-Amboise 1519
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alain Jaubert, Delta Image, La Sept, FR3 and Musée du Louvre

results.title: A fin de siecle legend: decoration of the booth of La Goulue, 1895, Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec (Albi 1864-Malrome 1901)
results.creator_credit: Alain Jaubert, Musee D'Orsay, Delta Image, FR3 and La Sept
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Palettes”.
La Goulue, the celebrated cancan dancer and queen of late night Paris during the Belle Epoque, asked her friend Toulouse-Lautrec to paint two panels to decorate her carnival booth. The artist’s two largest canvases were to have an extraordinary destiny. This video describes the panels in detail and the techniques which Lautrec used to paint them, as well as setting them in their artistic and social context.
results.title_for_label: A fin de siecle legend: decoration of the booth of La Goulue, 1895, Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec (Albi 1864-Malrome 1901)

results.title: Utopia,orange,green,purple:A Sunday on La Grande Jatte,1884
results.creator_credit: Alain Jaubert, Delta Image, RMN, FR3 and La Sept
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Palettes”.
Georges Seurat was a painter of the edge, the border, passage and nowhere is this more clearly seen than in his two major paintings set on the island of La Grande Jatte in the Seine, “La Baignade” and “Un dimanche sur la Grande Jatte, 1884”. This program looks closely at the similarities between the two huge paintings, the sketches and drawings that he made beforehand and at his scientific study of colour and light which resulted in his pointillist technique.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alain Jaubert, Delta Image, RMN, FR3 and La Sept

results.title: The Color of the Moment: Japanese Bridges, Claude Monet
results.creator_credit: Alain Jaubert, Delta Image, FR3 and La Sept
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Palettes”.
At Giverny near Paris, Claude Monet created a garden, which included a large pond, which he filled with waterlilies and over which he built a Japanese bridge. This pond and the bridge featured in many series of paintings throughout his life there, and this program looks at them in detail. Monet pioneered the ‘series’ painting but it is “the dance of the brush and the vibration of light” for which he will be remembered.
results.title_for_label: The Color of the Moment: Japanese Bridges, Claude Monet
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alain Jaubert, Delta Image, FR3 and La Sept

results.title: Miracle in the loggia: Madonna with Chancellor Rolin
results.creator_credit: Alain Jaubert, Les Films d'Ici, Delta Image, FR3 and La Sept
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Palettes”.
Jan van Eyck’s “Madonna with Chancellor Rolin” painted around 1435, is one of the first known oil paintings. Filled with microscopic detail and demonstrating early experiments with perspective, this painting features the figure of Nicolas Rolin, Chancellor of Burgundy and influential in the arts from Autin to Burgundy. As well as demonstrating the techniques and symbolism of the painting, this program also describes the historical context of The Hundred Years War.
results.title_for_label: Miracle in the loggia: Madonna with Chancellor Rolin
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alain Jaubert, Les Films d’Ici, Delta Image, FR3 and La Sept

As well as demonstrating the techniques and symbolism of the painting, this program also describes the historical context of The Hundred Years War.

results.title: Pictures beneath the cobblestones: July 28th, 1830 Liberty leading the people(1830)
results.creator_credit: Alain Jaubert, Les Films d'Ici, Delta Image, FR3 and La Sept
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Palettes”.
Delacroix’s picture “Liberty leading the people” was painted in 1830 and depicts the uprising in Paris which resulted in the installation of Louis Philipe as king. This program looks in detail at the painting itself, the techniques that Delacroix used, outside influences on his art, the symbolism he uses and the reception his painting received, as well as looking briefly at the events which inspired the work.
results.title_for_label: Pictures beneath the cobblestones: July 28th, 1830 Liberty leading the people(1830)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alain Jaubert, Les Films d’Ici, Delta Image, FR3 and La Sept

results.title: Winter garden. Sailor's consolation. Check to song
results.creator_credit: Michael Warne, Joan Maude, John Halas, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and British Film Institute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Painter and poet: an experiment in words, music and paintings”.
The second part of a series devised by Joan Maude and Michael Warre incorporating the works of writers, painters and musicians to create an experimental animated film. This part consists of three short films. ‘Winter garden’ by David Gascoigne, narrated by Michael Redgrave, painted by Barbara Jones (2:17 mins). ‘The Sailor’s consolation’ by Thomas Dibden, narrated by Stanley Holloway, drawings by John Minton (1:40 mins). ‘Check to song!’ by Owen Meredith, narrated by Eric Portman, drawings by Michael Warre (1:10 mins). Photography by W. Traylor and R. Turk, music by Matyas Seiber, edited by Jack King.

results.title: In time of pestilence. The Pythoness
results.creator_credit: Michael Warne, Joan Maude, John Halas, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and British Film Institute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Painter and poet: an experiment in words, music and paintings”.
The third part of a series devised by Joan Maude and Michael Warre incorporating the works of writers, painters and musicians to create an experimental animated film. This part consists of two short films. ‘In time of pestilence’ by Thomas Nashe, narrated by Robert Harris, drawings by Michael Ayrton (3:18 mins). ‘The Pythoness’ by Kathleen Raine, narrated by Mary Morris, drawings by Henry Moore (2:00 mins). Photography by W. Traylor and R. Turk, music by Matyas Seiber, edited by Jack King.

results.title: Twa corbies. Spring and winter
results.creator_credit: Michael Warre, Joan Maude, John Halas, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and British Film Institute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Painter and poet: an experiment in words, music and paintings”.
The first part of a series devised by John Maude and Michael Warre incorporating the works of writers, painters and musicians to create an experimental animated film. This part consists of two short films. ‘Twa corbies’ by anonymous narrated by John Laurie, drawings by Michael Rothenstien (2:24 mins). ‘Spring and winter’ by William Shakespeare, music by Dr. Arne and sung by Peter Pears, drawings by Mervyn Peake (5:40 mins). Photography by W. Traylor and R. Turk, music by Matyas Seiber, edited by Jack King.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Warre, Joan Maude, John Halas, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and British Film Institute

results.title: Painter and poet: an experiment in words, music and paintings
results.creator_credit: Michael Warre, Joan Maude, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: A four part series, containing a total of 8 short films for which contempory British painters were commissioned to script in picture, a poem. Each film is accompanied by music and narrated by English performers. The films were produced by John Halas in association with Joan Maude and Michael Warre who devised the script in co-operation with the painters.
results.title_for_label: Painter and poet: an experiment in words, music and paintings
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Warre, Joan Maude, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
